answers.answer: You could have an overactive bladder.  I know there is medication to treat an overactive bladder.  You probablyshould check in with your GYN/GP to see what he/she recommends.Could you be pregnant?  An increased need to urinate is alsoa symptom of pregnancy.  Good luck!

HiIt could be ur drinking alot and not eating enough? Or stress? I dunno if it can but it seems stress can do alot of things according to my gp. I cant remember ur last post but u had ur period done a hpt etc? Could also be a mild infection?Hope it all works out, I know what its like Im like that at the mo...like every few minutes (well maybe not wuite as mich but sometimes it is and I go like I never went all day!)
first off it wouldnt be her fanny muscles. it could be her pelvic floor muscles that need to be strenghtened like keigle exercises. is that what you MEANT to say????

no, she's not trying to be funny. she is trying to stir up **** and i think i am falling into her trap!  i am BURNING up here!
hee hee hee!  Breathe 1,2,3; breathe 1,2,3.  :-)  The posts just seem like things that a couple of teenage boys would cook up.

Thanks to those who gave serious answers. No, I'm not pregnant.  I guess overactive bladder could have just come on very quickly. Ughh...it is horrid.......Can stress do it??  Yeah, I know stress can do a lot of odd things to our body. I didn't think about that. I have been under a lot of stress lately with some major life decisions. I did think about that with all the female problems but when they got a little better and this didn't go away I thought maybe this is different.  Well, I guess maybe there is hope of it getting better if its stress!! Right??!!!
I'm not sure if she's trying (unsuccessfully) to be funny, or if she's just trying to stir sh*t up. She has an intellect rivaled only by rocks, though.
Exceive need to urinate is also a possible sign of Diabetes. Are you thristy all the time?  Does Diabetes run in your family?  Contact you doctor.  if it bothers you that much.

question: Okay, I asked earlier about pain, discomfort and I think you all may have been right that it was ovulation pain. I had never had it before.  That discomfort is better, much better, but I'm still having to urinate all the time.  I don't have any burning when I do it.  I don't have other symptoms of UTI or anything like that....any ideas why I would still need to pee all the time??????  Last month and the month before, it got better.....I'm wondering if its going to get better this time.Thanks in advance
title: Constant Need to Urnate
